item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, September 15, 2024 at 4:20 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Bitcoin puzzle #66 was solved: 6.6 BTC (~$400k) withdrawn (56 points | 39 comments)
2. Compression Dictionary Transport (14 points | discuss)
3. The Disunity of Consciousness in Everyday Experience (67 points | 42 comments)
4. Declarative Programming with AI/LLMs (9 points | 2 comments)
5. Show HN: Wordllama – Things you can do with the token embeddings of an LLM (263 points | 16 comments)
6. Retiring from the Idea of Retirement (18 points | 11 comments)
7. Randomness extractors: making fair coins out of biased coins (5 points | discuss)
8. Open Source security camera on Raspberry Pi (9 points | discuss)
9. OpenSCAD: The Programmer's Solid 3D CAD Modeller (388 points | 139 comments)
10. Throwable tactical camera transmits 360° panoramic thermal images (30 points | 9 comments)
11. AT&T's Hobbit Microprocessor (2023) (60 points | 19 comments)
12. Carma (YC W24) Is Hiring Software Engineers to Get Fleets Same-Day Auto Repair ( | hide)
13. Lazarus Group laundered $200M from 25 crypto hacks to fiat (231 points | 147 comments)
14. Designing mathematics standards in agreement with science [pdf] (6 points | discuss)
15. Jensen's Inequality as an Intuition Tool (4 points | discuss)
16. The art of niwaki (Japanese tree pruning) (43 points | 1 comment)
17. The Death of the Magazine (25 points | 14 comments)
18. One in five genetics papers contains errors thanks to Microsoft Excel (2016) (341 points | 207 comments)
19. Learn Git Branching (15 points | 3 comments)
20. i3wm inspired wm for Windows (43 points | 11 comments)
21. Mastering Null Semantics: Translating SQL Expressions to OpenSearch DSL (27 points | 5 comments)
22. Powerful, Open-Source, Programmatic CAD (75 points | 9 comments)
23. Writing an OS in Rust (370 points | 40 comments)
24. The Bastard Operator from Hell (1999) (223 points | 74 comments)
25. NASA Mission Gets Its First Snapshot of Polar Heat Emissions (6 points | discuss)
26. Terence Tao on O1 (613 points | 394 comments)
27. Logbookd – SQLite Backed Syslogd (51 points | 10 comments)
28. CSCI 181G PO: Game Engine Programming (90 points | 13 comments)
29. Strtod Is Wild (41 points | 12 comments)
30. We're not going to run out of new anatomy anytime soon (123 points | 60 comments)
